introduction.title: 1. Purpose of this notice
introduction.content: This Privacy Policy explains how the law office of Marina Ilyushina, established at Stournari 39, Athens 106 82, Greece, processes personal data when you browse https://milawyer.gr, contact us, or become a client. We comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679, Law 4624/2019 and Law 3471/2006. By engaging with the Website you acknowledge that you have read this notice.

dataCollection.title: 2. Personal data we collect
dataCollection.content: We only collect information that is necessary to respond to enquiries, assess potential engagements and deliver our legal services.
list: Identification details such as your first name, last name, nationality and professional capacity.
Contact details including email address, telephone number, correspondence address and preferred language of communication.
Background information relating to your matter such as documents you voluntarily provide, meeting notes, timelines and counterparties.
Technical and usage data (IP address, browser type, device identifiers, language settings, referral URLs and analytics data) generated through cookies and similar technologies.
dataCollection.note: Please avoid sharing special categories of data (e.g. health information or data about minors) through online forms unless we specifically request them during a secure exchange.

dataCollectionMethods.title: 3. How we obtain data
dataCollectionMethods.content: Personal data reaches us in three ways:
list: directly from you when you call, email, book a consultation or sign an engagement letter
through supporting professionals who collaborate on your case after you authorise the exchange
automatically via cookies and analytics tools that measure the performance and security of the Website
dataCollectionMethods.additional: We do not purchase marketing lists nor scrape social media. Any third-party data we receive is checked to make sure the disclosure was lawful before we store it.

legalBasis.title: 4. Legal bases for processing
legalBasis.content: Processing is carried out on one or more of the following lawful bases under Article 6 GDPR:
list: Contractual necessity ‚Äì to review your request, perform a conflict check and provide legal services.
Legal obligation ‚Äì to comply with statutory duties (anti-money laundering, accounting, professional conduct).
Consent ‚Äì for optional actions such as subscribing to updates or receiving event invitations. You may withdraw your consent at any time.
Legitimate interest ‚Äì to secure our systems, improve our services, manage our relationship and defend legal claims.

dataUsage.title: 5. How we use personal data
dataUsage.content: We use the personal data we collect for the following purposes:
list: responding to enquiries and scheduling consultations
conducting conflict checks and onboarding new clients
preparing, negotiating and executing legal strategies on your behalf
maintaining billing, file management and document archiving processes
monitoring site performance, preventing fraud and safeguarding communications
sending essential updates, legal alerts or invitations that may interest our clients
dataUsage.note: We do not sell personal data, use automated decision-making, or profile visitors for advertising purposes.

dataSharing.title: 6. Disclosure of data
dataSharing.content: Your data is treated as confidential. We only disclose it when necessary:
dataSharing.additional: Trusted processors (cloud hosting within the EU, secure email provider, bookkeeping support) process data under written agreements and only on our instructions. Where we need to collaborate with co-counsel, notaries, interpreters or experts, we share the minimum data required and always subject to professional secrecy. We store data in the EU. If a transfer outside the EEA becomes necessary, we rely on GDPR-approved safeguards such as Standard Contractual Clauses.

rights.title: 7. Your rights
rights.content: You may exercise the following rights at any time, subject to legal limitations:
list: access to the personal data we hold about you
rectification of inaccurate or incomplete data
erasure when data is no longer required or processing is unlawful
restriction of processing pending verification or objection
data portability where we process data based on consent or contract
objection to processing carried out on legitimate interest grounds
withdrawal of consent without affecting prior lawful processing
lodging a complaint with the Hellenic Data Protection Authority (www.dpa.gr)
rights.contact: To exercise your rights, email ilyushina.law@gmail.com or write to Marina Ilyushina Law Office, Stournari 39, Athens 106 82, Greece.

security.title: 8. Information security
security.content: We implement layered safeguards such as encrypted communications (HTTPS and secure email gateways), hardened devices, role-based access controls, regular backups and confidentiality agreements with staff and partners.
security.additional: Despite our efforts, no online transmission can be guaranteed absolutely secure. Please contact us if you suspect any unauthorised use of your data.

retention.title: 9. Retention periods
retention.content: We retain personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes outlined above and to comply with professional obligations.
list: Initial enquiries and declined matters: kept for up to 18 months to document conflict checks.
Client case files: stored for at least 5 years after the conclusion of the matter, unless longer retention is required by law or requested by the client.
Accounting and tax records: retained for 10 years in accordance with Greek legislation.

cookies.title: 10. Cookies and analytics
cookies.content: Essential cookies keep the Website secure and functional. Optional analytics cookies (e.g. Google Analytics 4) help us understand aggregated usage trends. You can change preferences at any time via the cookie banner or by adjusting your browser settings.

changes.title: 11. Updates to this policy
changes.content: We may revise this Privacy Policy to reflect legal or operational changes. The updated version will be published on this page with a new revision date.

contact.title: 12. Contact details
contact.content: For privacy questions or requests please reach out to:
